result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barron Lavell Terrell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barron Lavell Terrell in court.  Attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski in court for Barron Lavell Terrell.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs to complete the community service hours. Defendant has completed the essay and the firearm safety class. In order to receive the benefits of the agreement, defendant needs to complete community service. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Revised DPA Update 9-19-22
Received and Filed. CCW FSC Signed certificate.pdf
Received and Filed. Barron Terrell essay

Defendant Barron Lavell Terrell in court with attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY.
Defendant examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.
and Early Intervention Program CCW DPA
to the Court regarding Phone Number Change

Defendant Barron Lavell Terrell in court with attorney for Emick  for  Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for Status Conference. State emailed defense counsel the dpa document. Defense request a hearing,
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Barron Lavell Terrell in court with attorney Adam Joseph Kachelski.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a pre-trial conference. 
Discussion held off the record. Defense has discovery and offer and advises the court this may resolve with a DPA.
Defense requests an adjournment to allow time for a TAD evaluation. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 

This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Barron Lavell Terrell in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 2p
